places.name: Antigua Guatemala
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its preserved Spanish Baroque-influenced architecture and the ruins of colonial churches.

places.name: Lake Atitlán
places.description: A beautiful lake surrounded by volcanoes and Mayan villages, often called one of the most beautiful lakes in the world.

places.name: Tikal National Park
places.description: An ancient Mayan citadel deep in the rainforest, featuring towering temples and rich archaeological significance.

places.name: Semuc Champey
places.description: A natural monument known for its series of turquoise pools formed on a limestone bridge over the Cahabón River.

places.name: Pacaya Volcano
places.description: An active volcano offering hiking trails and views of flowing lava, with panoramic sights of the Guatemalan highlands.
